query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 «Ecco la fiera con la coda aguzza, 2 che passa i monti e rompe i muri e l’armi! 3 Ecco colei che tutto ’l mondo appuzza!».
query.result:
**English:**
1 "Behold the beast with the sharp tail, 2 that crosses mountains and breaks through walls and weapons! 3 Behold her who stinks up the whole world!"
**Sanskrit:**
1 "Paśya mṛgīm śikhariṇīm, 2 yā parvatān ativartate, prākārān astraśca bhinatti! 3 Paśya tām yāḥ samastaṃ jagat duhkhitaṃ karoti!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Sì cominciò lo mio duca a parlarmi; 5 e accennolle che venisse a proda, 6 vicino al fin d’i passeggiati marmi.
query.result:
**English:**
4 My guide began to speak to me; 5 and beckoned me to come to the shore, 6 near the end of the marble pavement.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Sa ārabhata mama naiḥśreyasakaraḥ pathikaḥ mama sahitam vaktum; 5 sa ca mama ādiśat āgacchatv iti tīram prati, 6 anta-samipe śilā-paṭṭikānāṃ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 E quella sozza imagine di froda 8 sen venne, e arrivò la testa e ’l busto, 9 ma ’n su la riva non trasse la coda.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And that foul image of fraud 8 came forward, and reached the head and bust, 9 but did not drag its tail upon the shore.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Tathā ca sā duritā mṛṣāyāḥ pratimā 8 ājagāma, tataś ca śīrṣaṃ mūrdhā ca ājagmatām, 9 na tu puccham tīre ākarṣayat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Con più color, sommesse e sovraposte 17 non fer mai drappi Tartari né Turchi, 18 né fuor tai tele per Aragne imposte.
query.result:
**English:**
16 With more colors, subdued and superimposed, 17 never did Tartar or Turkish cloths make, 18 nor tapestries set up for Arachne outside.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Adhikairvarṇaiḥ, nīcairatiriktaiśca, 17 na kadācit Tārtārāḥ na vā Turuṣkāḥ vastrāṇi cakruḥ, 18 na vā bahiḥ Aragnaye vastrāṇi sthāpitāni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Come talvolta stanno a riva i burchi, 20 che parte sono in acqua e parte in terra, 21 e come là tra li Tedeschi lurchi
22 lo bivero s’assetta a far sua guerra, 23 così la fiera pessima si stava 24 su l’orlo ch’è di pietra e ’l sabbion serra.
query.result:
**English:**
19 As sometimes boats stand by the shore, 20 that are partly in the water and partly on land, 21 and as there among the lazy Germans
22 the beaver settles down to wage its war, 23 so the evil beast stood 24 on the edge that is of stone and encloses the sand.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Yathā kadācit tīre naurāḥ tiṣṭhanti, 20 tāḥ aṁśataḥ jale aṁśataś ca sthale, 21 tathā tatra madhye ālasānāṃ jarmanāṃ
22 udadhir viśrāmyati svaṃ yuddhaṃ kartum, 23 tathā sā durātmanā mṛgī tiṣṭhati sma 24 śilāmayaḥ kaṇṭhe yasya vālukāṃ samvaraṇena karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Nel vano tutta sua coda guizzava, 26 torcendo in sù la venenosa forca 27 ch’a guisa di scorpion la punta armava.
query.result:
**English:**
25 In the void, its entire tail thrashed about, 26 twisting upward the venomous fork 27 that, like a scorpion's, armed its tip.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Śūnye tasya sarvā pucchaḥ spandate sma, 26 Ūrdhvam vartayann viṣamaṃ śṛṅgam 27 Yathā vṛścikasya agraṃ śastram iva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Lo duca disse: «Or convien che si torca 29 la nostra via un poco insino a quella 30 bestia malvagia che colà si corca».
query.result:
**English:**
28 The leader said: "Now it is necessary that 29 our path turn a little towards that 30 evil beast that lies down over there."
**Sanskrit:**
28 Nāyakaḥ uvāca: "Adyaiva āvaśyakam asti yathā 29 asmākam mārgaḥ alpaṃ viparīyeta yāvat tāṃ 30 durjanam mṛgam yā tatra śete."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Però scendemmo a la destra mammella, 32 e diece passi femmo in su lo stremo, 33 per ben cessar la rena e la fiammella.
query.result:
**English:**
31 But we descended to the right shoulder, 32 and we took ten steps along the edge, 33 in order to avoid both the sand and the flame.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Tataḥ dakṣiṇamaṁsāyaṃ praviveśava, 32 Daśa padāni ca cakrame streme, 34 Śubham iva varjayitum vālukāṃ ca jvālām ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 E quando noi a lei venuti semo, 35 poco più oltre veggio in su la rena 36 gente seder propinqua al loco scemo.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And when we came to her, 35 a little farther on I see upon the sand 36 people sitting near the empty place.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Evaṃ ca asmābhiḥ tatra gatān, 35 alpameva aparam paśyāmi śuklāyām iva bhūmau 36 janān upaviṣṭān tatra śūnya-sthānasyāsannikṛṣṭam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Quivi ’l maestro «Acciò che tutta piena 38 esperïenza d’esto giron porti», 39 mi disse, «va, e vedi la lor mena.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Here the master said to me, "In order that you may carry away a full 38 experience of this circle," 39 "go and see their punishment."
**Sanskrit:**
37 Atraiva gurur uvāca, "Yathā tvam pūrṇām 38 anubhūtim asya maṇḍalasya praṇeṣyasi," 39 "gaccha, paśya ca teṣām śikṣām."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Li tuoi ragionamenti sian là corti; 41 mentre che torni, parlerò con questa, 42 che ne conceda i suoi omeri forti».
query.result:
**English:**
40 Let your arguments be brief; 41 while you return, I will speak with this one, 42 that she may grant us her strong shoulders.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Tavaiṣaṇāni bhavantulaghu; 41 yāvad āgacchasi, aham asyāḥ saha samvadisyāmi, 42 yathā sā asmākam balavanto bāhūn dadāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Così ancor su per la strema testa 44 di quel settimo cerchio tutto solo 45 andai, dove sedea la gente mesta.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Thus still further on, over the outermost head 44 of that seventh circle, all alone 45 I went, where the sorrowful people were seated.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Evam aparam api uttaraśirasi 44 saptamamaṇḍalasya eka eva 45 agam, yatra duḥkhitāḥ janāḥ āsīnaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Per li occhi fora scoppiava lor duolo; 47 di qua, di là soccorrien con le mani 48 quando a’ vapori, e quando al caldo suolo:
49 non altrimenti fan di state i cani 50 or col ceffo or col piè, quando son morsi 51 o da pulci o da mosche o da tafani.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Through their eyes their suffering burst forth; 47 here and there they helped themselves with their hands, 48 now to the vapors, and now to the hot soil:
49 in the same way do dogs in summer 50 now with their snout, now with their paw, when they are bitten 51 either by fleas or by flies or by gadflies.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Netrābhyām teṣām duḥkham sphuṭati sma; 47 atra atra hastābhyām ātmānam rakṣanti sma 48 kadācit dhūmebhyaḥ, kadācit uṣṇabhūtale:
49 na anyathā grīṣme śvānaḥ karoti 50 kadācit mukhena kadācit pādena, yadā daṣṭaḥ bhavati 51 vā yūkādibhiḥ makṣikādibhiḥ kṛmibhiḥ vā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Poi che nel viso a certi li occhi porsi, 53 ne’ quali ’l doloroso foco casca, 54 non ne conobbi alcun; ma io m’accorsi
55 che dal collo a ciascun pendea una tasca 56 ch’avea certo colore e certo segno, 57 e quindi par che ’l loro occhio si pasca.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then, when I turned my eyes to their faces, 53 in which the sorrowful fire fell, 54 I recognized none of them; but I noticed
55 that from the neck of each one hung a pouch 56 that had a certain color and a certain sign, 57 and it seemed that their eyes fed on that.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Tataḥ, yadāham teṣāṃ mukheṣu nayanaṃ nyakṣipam, 53 yeṣu śokāgnir nipatati sma, 54 na keñcanaham ajānāṃ, kim tu mām abodhata
55 yataḥ eṣāṃ grīvāyāṃ pratyekasya kośaḥ alambate sma 56 yasya niścitaḥ varṇaḥ niścitaṃ ca lakṣaṇam āsīt, 57 tataś ca teṣāṃ cakṣuḥ tatra eva tr̥pyati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 E com’ io riguardando tra lor vegno, 59 in una borsa gialla vidi azzurro 60 che d’un leone avea faccia e contegno.
query.result:
**English:**
58 And as I was looking among them, 59 in a yellow purse I saw azure, 60 which had the face and bearing of a lion.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Evaṃ ca mama paśyataḥ teṣāṃ madhye, 59 pītavarṇe kośe adṛśyam ābhram, 60 yasya siṃhasya vaktram āśayśca āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Poi, procedendo di mio sguardo il curro, 62 vidine un’altra come sangue rossa, 63 mostrando un’oca bianca più che burro.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then, continuing my gaze, 62 I saw another one, red as blood, 63 showing a white goose, whiter than butter.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tataḥ, mama dṛṣṭeḥ agrataḥ pravṛtte sati, 62 anyām api aśvam iva raktavarṇām apaśyam, 63 śvetahamsīṃ navanīta-śuklātaḥ api adhika-śuklām darśayantīm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 E un che d’una scrofa azzurra e grossa 65 segnato avea lo suo sacchetto bianco, 66 mi disse: «Che fai tu in questa fossa?
67 Or te ne va; e perché se’ vivo anco, 68 sappi che ’l mio vicin Vitalïano 69 sederà qui dal mio sinistro fianco.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And one who had his white pouch marked 65 with a big blue sow, 66 said to me: "What are you doing in this ditch?
67 Now go away; and since you are still alive, 68 know that my neighbor Vitaliano 69 will sit here on my left side.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Ekaśca yasya śuklakośaḥ āsīt 65 mahānīlavarāhasya lakṣaṇena yuktaḥ, 66 sa mama āha: "Kim tvam karoṣi asmin khaṇḍe?
67 Adyaiva tvam gaccha; athavā yadi jīvan asi, 68 jānīhi mama prativāsinaṃ Vitalyānam 69 atraiva mad-vāme pārśve āsyatīti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Con questi Fiorentin son padoano: 71 spesse fïate mi ’ntronan li orecchi 72 gridando: “Vegna ’l cavalier sovrano,
73 che recherà la tasca con tre becchi!”».
query.result:
**English:**
70 With these Florentines I am a Paduan: 71 often they deafen my ears 72 shouting: “Let the sovereign cavalier come,
73 who will bring the pouch with three spouts!”
**Sanskrit:**
70 Etaiḥ Fiorentinaiḥ saha aham Pādovano 'smi: 71 anekaśaḥ me śrotraṇayo roṣayanti, 72 uccaiḥ krandantaḥ: “Āgacchatv adhipatiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ,
73 yaḥ ānayati trivaktraṃ kośam!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
74 Qui distorse la bocca e di fuor trasse 75 la lingua, come bue che ’l naso lecchi.
76 E io, temendo no ’l più star crucciasse 77 lui che di poco star m’avea ’mmonito, 78 torna’mi in dietro da l’anime lasse.
query.result:
**English:**
74 Here he twisted his mouth and thrust out 75 his tongue, like an ox that licks its nose.
76 And I, fearing that he might torment himself further, 77 he who had just warned me to stay a short while, 78 turned back from the weary souls.
**Sanskrit:**
74 Atra vakram akarod vaktram tataś ca bahiḥ 75 jihvām aniniṣe yathā gāvaḥ nāsikām lihanti.
76 Aham ca bibhyataḥ na khalu ayam adhikam pidām ātmānam iti, 77 yaḥ alpam sthātum mām amanayat, 78 pratyāvṛttaḥ asmi paścāt klāntātmabhyaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Trova’ il duca mio ch’era salito 80 già su la groppa del fiero animale, 81 e disse a me: «Or sie forte e ardito.
query.result:
**English:**
79 My guide, who had already mounted 80 upon the back of the fierce beast, 81 said to me: "Now be strong and bold.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Mama naimittikaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ āruhya 80 tataḥ ugraḥ mṛgaḥ agre, 81 uvāca mama: "Idānīm bhavatu bala-vān dhairya-vān ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Omai si scende per sì fatte scale; 83 monta dinanzi, ch’i’ voglio esser mezzo, 84 sì che la coda non possa far male».
query.result:
**English:**
82 Now one descends by such a stairway; 83 go thou before, for I wish to be in the middle, 84 so that the tail cannot do harm."
**Sanskrit:**
82 Adyaivaivamvidhaiḥsopānair avarohanti; 83 Agre gaccha, aham madhye bhavitum icchāmi, 84 Yathā puccham na śaknoti hiṃsāṃ kartum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Qual è colui che sì presso ha ’l riprezzo 86 de la quartana, c’ha già l’unghie smorte, 87 e triema tutto pur guardando ’l rezzo,
88 tal divenn’ io a le parole porte; 89 ma vergogna mi fé le sue minacce, 90 che innanzi a buon segnor fa servo forte.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Like one who is so close to the shivering 86 of a quartan fever that his nails are already turning pale, 87 and he trembles all over, even just looking at the shade,
88 so I became at the words spoken; 89 but shame made me strong against his threats, 90 which makes a servant bold before a good lord.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Yaḥ kuṣṭharogasya parikṣīṇanakhraḥ 86 Sarvaśarīraḥ kampate chāyāmātreṇa,
87 Sa tathāhaṃ jātaḥ tadvacanaiḥ, 88 Api ca lajjayā balavān abhūvam tasya bhayavacanaiḥ, 89 Yā śreṣṭhasya puruṣasya purataḥ dāsamapi śūram karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 I’ m’assettai in su quelle spallacce; 92 sì volli dir, ma la voce non venne 93 com’ io credetti: ‘Fa che tu m’abbracce’.
query.result:
**English:**
91 I seated myself on those shoulders; 92 I wanted to say to him, but my voice did not come out 93 as I thought: ‘Make me embrace you’.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Aham tās tāḥ skandhe aasede; 92 Tathā ahaṃ vaditum icchiṣam, api tu vāṇī na nirgata 93 Yathā aham manye: ‘Mama āliṅganaṃ kuru’.

**English:**
94 But he, who had come to my mind before, 95 perhaps for some other purpose, as soon as I mounted, 96 embraced me with his arms and held me tight;
97 and said: "Geryon, move now: 98 let your circles be wide, and your descent slow; 99 consider the new burden that you have."
**Sanskrit:**
94 Sa tu, yaḥ pūrvaṃ mama smṛtau āgataḥ āsīt, 95 anyatra vā api, yadā aham āruhya āsam, 96 bāhubhyām mām āśliṣya dhṛtaḥ.
97 Uvāca ca: "Geryon, calyatām adhunā: 98 cakrāṇi vistīrṇāni bhavanti, avarohaṇaṃ ca mandam astu; 99 cintyaṃ navam bhāram yat tvayi asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Come la navicella esce di loco 101 in dietro in dietro, sì quindi si tolse; 102 e poi ch’al tutto si sentì a gioco,
103 là ’v’ era ’l petto, la coda rivolse, 104 e quella tesa, come anguilla, mosse, 105 e con le branche l’aere a sé raccolse.
query.result:
**English:**
100 As a little boat leaves its place, 101 backing away, so he withdrew; 102 and when he felt himself quite at large,
103 he turned his tail where his chest had been, 104 and moved that forked tongue of his, like an eel, 105 and gathered the air to himself with his wings.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Yathā nāvikā sthānāt niḥsṛtā 101 pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhataḥ, tathā sa tataḥ apākṛṣṭaḥ; 102 tataś ca yaḥ sarvataḥ svacchandam anubabhūva,
103 tatra yatra vakṣaḥ āsīt, tatra puccham cakāra, 104 sa ca bhinnajihvaḥ, sarpa iva, calitaḥ, 105 tataś ca pakṣābhyām vāyum ātmani samāharati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Maggior paura non credo che fosse 107 quando Fetonte abbandonò li freni, 108 per che ’l ciel, come pare ancor, si cosse;
109 né quando Icaro misero le reni 110 sentì spennar per la scaldata cera, 111 gridando il padre a lui «Mala via tieni!»,
112 che fu la mia, quando vidi ch’i’ era 113 ne l’aere d’ogne parte, e vidi spenta 114 ogne veduta fuor che de la fera.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I do not believe that there was greater fear 107 when Phaethon abandoned the reins, 108 because of which the sky, as it still appears, was scorched;
109 nor when wretched Icarus felt his wings 110 melt due to the heated wax, 111 his father crying out to him, "You are taking a bad course!",
112 than mine was, when I saw that I was 113 in the air on all sides, and I saw every 114 sight extinguished except for that of the beast.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Na manye bhayam adhikaṃ babhūva 107 yadā Phaetōn ratham parityajya jagāma, 108 yena nabhaḥ, yathā adyāpi dṛśyate, dagdham abhavat;
109 na vā yadā Icarō daridraḥ pakṣau 110 dagdham mṛdvikām kṛtvā patanāya jagāma, 111 piturāha tasmai "Ku-mārgaṃ gacchasi!",
112 yathā mama abhavat, yadā aham apaśyam yadi 113 nabhaḥ sarvataḥ asti, apaśyam ca sarvām 114 dṛṣṭim vināśitām vyatiriktaṃ mṛgāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Ella sen va notando lenta lenta; 116 rota e discende, ma non me n’accorgo 117 se non che al viso e di sotto mi venta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 She goes away, moving slowly, slowly; 116 she weeps and descends, but I do not notice it, 117 except that the wind blows on my face and from below.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Sā gacchati avalokayantī mandamandāt, 116 rudatī ca avaśīrṇā ca, atha kim aham na jānāmi, 117 kim tu mukhe adhastād vāyuḥ mama spr̥śati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Io sentia già da la man destra il gorgo 119 far sotto noi un orribile scroscio, 120 per che con li occhi ’n giù la testa sporgo.
query.result:
**English:**
118 I already heard from the right hand side the whirlpool 119 making a horrible roar below us, 120 because of which I lean my head down with my eyes.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Aham śṛṇomi sma dakṣiṇataḥ eva gorgaḥ 119 Kurvan adhastāt asmān ghoraṃ śabdam, 120 Yasmāt adhaḥ śirasā akṣiṇī vikṣipāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Allor fu’ io più timido a lo stoscio, 122 però ch’i’ vidi fuochi e senti’ pianti; 123 ond’ io tremando tutto mi raccoscio.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then I was more fearful at the sound, 122 because I saw fires and heard cries; 123 whereat, trembling, I huddled all together.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Tatra aham adhikaṃ bhayam abhavam tasmin śabde, 122 yataḥ aham agnīṃś cakṣuṣā apaśyam, krandanāni ca aśrauṣam; 123 yataḥ kāmpamānaḥ sarva eva aham samkocāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 E vidi poi, ché nol vedea davanti, 125 lo scendere e ’l girar per li gran mali 126 che s’appressavan da diversi canti.
query.result:
**English:**
124 And then I saw, since I could not see it before, 125 the descent and the circling of the great evils 126 that were approaching from various sides.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Tataścaapaśyam, yataḥ pūrvam na paśyāmi sma, 125 avarohaṇam paribhramaṇam ca mahānām apakarṣāṇām, 126 ye vividheṣu diśāsu upajagmuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Come ’l falcon ch’è stato assai su l’ali, 128 che sanza veder logoro o uccello 129 fa dire al falconiere «Omè, tu cali!»,
130 discende lasso onde si move isnello, 131 per cento rote, e da lunge si pone 132 dal suo maestro, disdegnoso e fello;
133 così ne puose al fondo Gerïone 134 al piè al piè de la stagliata rocca, 135 e, discarcate le nostre persone,
136 si dileguò come da corda cocca.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Like the falcon that has been long on the wing, 128 that without seeing lure or bird 129 makes the falconer say, "Alas, you are dropping!",
130 descends weary to where he moves swiftly, 131 by a hundred circles, and alights at a distance 132 from his master, disdainful and fierce;
133 so Geryon set us down at the foot 134 of the cut-off rock, 135 and, our persons unloaded,
136 sped away like an arrow from a bowstring.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Yathā śakunaḥ kaścid dīrgham kālam pakṣayoḥ sthitaḥ, 128 yo na paśyan māṃsam vā pakṣiṇaṃ vā 129 śakunikam vadayati "Aha, patasi!",
130 śrāntaḥ avaśyati yatra sa vegaḥ sampadyate, 131 śataḥ parivartanair dūrato vā 132 svāmīnaḥ paścāt tiṣṭhati nirveśaḥ kopī ca;
133 evam asmān nyadhāt Geryoṇaḥ 134 śilāyāḥ chinnāyāḥ pādayoḥ pādayoḥ, 135 asmākam ca śarīrāṇi bhūmau nyāsya,
136 antaradhīyata yathā śareṇa rajjur vinirgatā.
